claim: Table that compares deaths from COVID-19 with other causes show the new coronavirus is harmless.
label: FALSE

claim: According to a BBC News screenshot, seven coronavirus victims in Rwanda were shot dead by unknown gunmen.
label: FALSE

claim: The case-death rate was fixed in Turkey on purpose.
label: FALSE

claim: In the United States, there are “360,000 (deaths) a year from swimming pools. But we don’t shut the country down for that.”
label: FALSE

claim: Some countries throw COVID-19 infected dead bodies into the seas.
label: FALSE

claim: Multiple posts shared repeatedly on Facebook and Twitter since March 2020 claim that Israel has reported zero deaths from the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19. The posts also claim Israeli citizens have protected themselves from COVID-19 by drinking a remedy of hot water, lemon and baking soda, which purportedly “kills” the virus.
label: FALSE

claim: Thailand reports first case of COVID-19 that infected from a dead body.
label: No evidence

claim: A viral image hints that flu cases are counted as coronavirus cases because there are about 24.500 less deaths by flu this year than two years ago.
label: Partially false

claim: The text claims that the coronavirus death rate in North Macedonia is the most devastating in the region.
label: Misleading

claim: The video shows the dead bodies of patients of COVID-19 dumped into the sea.
label: FALSE

claim: The news media has tried to pass off one man’s death, attributed to complications from COVID-19, as two separate cases.
label: FALSE

claim: Chinese state media claims Ghana’s coronavirus cases have surpassed 9,000, with over 400 deaths.
label: FALSE

claim: Joe Diffie’s death was labeled “as a COVID-19 death and it wasn’t!”
label: FALSE

claim: Justin Trudeau promises to pay off Tamil Nadu (India) government’s debt.
label: FALSE

claim: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte said China has highest COVID-19 death toll as of 4/3/2020.
label: FALSE
